title: July 6
description:
Felix is starting to be somewhat functionally literate! He knows a few sight words, and he sometimes uses letter cues to do real-world things (like figure out which bathroom is for boys). He's very nonchalant about it, but we know he must be very pleased with himself. We sure are!

Also, in the last month or two Felix has become afflicted by modesty. He no longer wants other kids to see him naked. It happened pretty suddenly and seemed prompted by nothing in particular. It's a little sad, but part of growing up we guess. Milo the naked boy has no such qualms yet.

Milo's growing in all sorts of ways, fast. He's shot up what seems like a few inches in a few weeks. His face is longer, his eyes are older and more knowledgeable. He's uses long, complicated sentences. He's making puns (like he saw a bad guy fall from a bridge into a crocodile pit and said, "He came to a DEAD END. Ha!"). Also, he wants to marry Lucie. Felix had the same marital aspirations at this age.

Dean's changing, too: he left Widgetbox last week! He's taking a little while off before jumping into the next thing. A few hours after his last day of work he hopped on a plane to visit Harriet in Singapore and Kuala Lumpur where she was for a conference. Here's pictures of Dean's trip.

So on this third week of summer vacation the kids weren't in summer camp yet and Dean was out of town. To preserve her sanity and get a little work done, Lucie sent the kids to spend the day at friends: Alexander's, Kahlil's, Ezekiel's, Keenan's, and Sofia's. There's also been playdates with Torin, Shiven, Connor, Owen, Phoebe, plus a couple of birthday parties.

We've run out of friends to offload the kids to. Fortunately, summer camp is starting next week. Perfect timing!

children.title: Drummer Boy
children.description: Milo follows his own beat.

children.title: Cordonice
children.description: Playdate at Cordonice Park with Perry, Katy, Owen, Ada, Dirk and Quinn.

children.title: Dirk & Quinn
children.description:
Dirk and Quinn.

His name is Quinn because he is Dirk's fifth and youngest son. Dirk also has 4 daughters. Impressive, isn't it?

children.title: creek
children.description: Looking for water bugs in Cordonice Creeks. All we found was a beer bottle cap.

children.title: Wruddle
children.description: Felix demonstrates his wruddling technique on Quin. Wruddling is a cross between wrestling and cuddling. Owen wasn't as versed in the art, but all the boys had fun (for the most part).

children.title: Slide
children.description: Quinn and Milo tirelessly climb the long concrete slide. Up up up...

children.title: Slide 2
children.description:
and down!

Quinn is 3. He will be starting EB in the fall, in PK.

children.title: Felix
children.description: Lucie offered the boys to cut the hair falling in their eyes, but they politely declined. Papa is the hair stylist in our household.

children.title: Milo
children.description: Milo is going through a major growth spurt. He is looking older, and sounding older, by the week.

children.title: Yeah!
children.description: Surprisingly, Felix still has all his front teeth. The two top ones have been loose for *months* now.

children.title: Horse Play
children.description:
Giddy up!

As Felix puts it: "You are lucky, Milo, because you have a big brother."

children.title: Horse Play 2
children.description: Felix, the good little horsey, awaits orders.

children.title: Singapore & Malaysia
children.description:
Dean went to Singapore (a city-state) and Kuala Lumpur (in Malaysia), where Harriet happened to be for a conference.

Go back to the rest of July 6, 2008.

children.title: Shiven
children.description: This week, we really got to know Shiven and his family. They live around the block from us, and Shiven goes to our school. They had a party last Sunday; we had them over for supper this Sunday; and we had 2 playdates in between. Let's hear it for neighborhood friends!

children.title: Space Knight
children.description: Shiven likes our costume box. He combined the Luke Skywalker jumpsuit, the Superman cape, a shiny belt and a sword to create a mean Space Knight costume.

children.title: Hammers
children.description: Felix, Shiven and Milo hammered rocks for what seemed like hours. Why bother with fancy toys when slave work is so entertaining?

children.title: Little rocks
children.description: Their goal was to make little tiny rocks to weight down the basketball hoop.

children.title: Tea Time
children.description: Hammering is hard work! The boys put aside their tools and safety goggles, and had themselves a dainty tea party.

children.title: Sofia
children.description: Sofia and a blossom from the Monkey Hand Tree, at the Botanical Garden.

children.title: Corpse Flower
children.description: We paid a visit to the Botanical Garden to admire the Corpse Flower, a huge stinky flower that only blooms once every 6 years, for 3 days.
